summary: Single-page marketing website for Gal Fashion World (ladies handbags manufacturer/exporter to UK & Europe) using provided company details and messaging.
architectural_notes: Website copy and contact details should reflect Gal Fashion World (address, phone/WhatsApp, email) and highlight UK/EU export + 10+ years experience.
Replace previously requested phrase “beautiful ladies with beautiful bags” with: “Behind every successful/beautiful woman is a fabulous handbag”.
Update visual theme to convert lilac accents to red across the site.
Update displayed company address: change "7-B/1" to "B-1" wherever the address appears on the site.
All visible text across the site should use italic styling (global typography update).
Proceed with publishing/deploying the current website build.
User approved proceeding to make the deployed site fully public/live; begin production/public publish workflow.
Production/public deployment should use the user-provided domain/slug: "galfashionworld-2014".
Remove all videos from the site (no Hero embedded video / autoplay video; eliminate video elements/sections).
Set global font family to Times New Roman with italic styling across the site; set font size to 20 for the text "Premium Ladies Handbag Manufacturer".

existing_features.title: Build a responsive single-page website frontend with the following sections and anchor navigation: Header (site name + nav links), Hero (headline, short tagline, primary CTA button), About (short paragraph), Features (3–6 feature cards), Contact (simple contact form UI with name/email/message fields and a submit button), and Footer (copyright + links). Use English for all visible text, using sensible placeholder copy that can be replaced later.

Apply a creative, coherent visual theme across the website (colors, typography, spacing, button styles, card styles) with a distinct style appropriate for a general-purpose website. Avoid a blue/purple-dominant palette. Enforce consistent styling across all sections.

Add static generated image assets to the project and use them in the layout: a hero illustration in the Hero section and a favicon for the browser tab. Store images under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them directly from the frontend (no backend routing).

Replace all placeholder branding and marketing copy across the single-page site with Gal Fashion World content, using the user-provided company details and the provided business statement in clear, professional English.
Update the Contact section to display the provided company contact details (email, phone/WhatsApp, and full address) and ensure the contact form microcopy is appropriate for B2B handbag inquiries.

Add the exact phrase “beautiful ladies with beautiful bags” as visible user-facing text on the site (in the Hero section or another prominent area) while keeping the overall copy professional and coherent.

Add handbag-with-model visuals to the website using newly generated static image assets (fabric fashion handbags with models) and integrate them into the layout (e.g., Hero image replacement and/or a small gallery/strip in an existing section).
Update site metadata to match Gal Fashion World branding, including the document title and meta description in frontend/index.html.

Update the Hero section to display a small embedded video clip of a model with handbags, replacing (or taking the place of) the current static hero image, and configure the video to auto-play silently.
Replace the currently displayed Hero tagline text “beautiful ladies with beautiful bags” with the exact phrase: “Behind every successful/beautiful woman is a fabulous handbag”.

Convert the site’s lilac/purple color theme accents to a red-based theme by updating the global theme color tokens so primary/accent/ring and related decorative elements render in red tones across the site (including dark mode tokens if present).
Update the displayed company address in the Contact section so the unit number changes from "7-B/1" to "B-1" (i.e., show "B-1, Dwarka" instead of the current "7/B-1, Dwarka").
Update global typography so all visible text across the site renders in italic by default (including headings, paragraphs, navigation, buttons, form labels, and footer text).

Ensure the Hero section video is visible and plays in the draft build by making sure the MP4 asset is present in the frontend static assets and loads successfully from the exact path "/assets/hero-handbag-model-video.mp4" (as referenced in frontend/src/components/Hero.tsx). If the video cannot be loaded, the existing fallback poster/image behavior must still display reliably.
Proceed with publishing/deploying the current Gal Fashion World single-page marketing website build so it is accessible as the live/production version.
Proceed with making the currently deployed Gal Fashion World single-page marketing website fully public/live as the production version.

Use the domain slug "galfashionworld-2014" for the Gal Fashion World production/public publish workflow so the deployment validation passes (5–50 characters; only letters, numbers, and hyphens) and the site is made fully public/live under that slug.

Proceed with the production/public publish workflow to make the currently deployed Gal Fashion World single-page website fully public/live, using the production domain slug "galfashionworld-2014" as defined in frontend/domain-slug.json.

Fix the Hero section video so it reliably plays on the live site using the existing video source path "/assets/hero-handbag-model-video.mp4" in frontend/src/components/Hero.tsx, while keeping the current fallback poster/image behavior.

Add the missing MP4 asset file to the frontend static assets at the exact public path frontend/public/assets/hero-handbag-model-video.mp4 so it matches the hardcoded source URL used by the Hero component.
Update the Hero layout so the video area is shorter/smaller (reduced vertical space) while preserving a clean responsive layout across mobile and desktop.
Add the user-uploaded bag photos (2024.jpg, 2024-1.jpg, 2309.png, 2309-1.png) to the site and display them in a non-Hero area (e.g., a small gallery section or strip placed outside the Hero section).

Add a new front-page showcase section (or extend the existing BagGallery section) that clearly highlights Gal Fashion World bags made of the following materials: cotton canvas, cotton towel, jacquard, paper raffia, jute, and beads/embroidery.

Add and display one representative image per requested material in the new/updated front-page materials showcase, using static assets stored under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly from the frontend.
Remove all videos from the website UI, including replacing the Hero section
Update global typography so all visible text across the site uses the font family "Times New Roman" (fallback to "Times" and then generic serif) and remains italic by default.
Set the font size to 20px for the displayed phrase "Premium Ladies Handbag Manufacturer" in the Hero section (the heading text containing "Premium Ladies" and "Handbag Manufacturer").

In the Materials & Craftsmanship showcase (BagGallery), remove the existing Jacquard material card/image and replace it with the user-uploaded white towel bag photo, and display the label text exactly as "Towel bag" below/on the photo where the material name appears.

In the Materials & Craftsmanship showcase (BagGallery), remove the existing "Beads / Embroidery" material card/image and replace it with the user-uploaded beaded bag photo, and display the label text exactly as "Beaded Clutch" below/on the photo where the material name appears.

Remove the four product boxes in the BagGallery “Our Collection” grid that correspond to: “black and white geometric pattern”, “stylish geometric pattern tote bag”, “colorful beaded clutch”, and “vibrant beaded evening clutch”, so they are no longer displayed on the website.

In the Materials & Craftsmanship grid (frontend/src/components/BagGallery.tsx), replace the currently displayed "beaded jute bag" card/image with the uploaded image "LMBG-36600-removebg-preview.png" and show it as a beaded clutch item (label in English). Ensure the old "beaded jute bag" card/image is no longer displayed anywhere in that grid.

Update the Materials & Craftsmanship grid in frontend/src/components/BagGallery.tsx to remove the existing "Towel bag" card and replace it with a "Jute" bag card that uses the uploaded image "/assets/Bg-02-17.jpg" (update alt text to match the new image).

Update the Materials & Craftsmanship grid in frontend/src/components/BagGallery.tsx to remove the existing "Beaded Clutch" card and replace it with a "Black & White Canvas" bag card that uses the uploaded image "/assets/3801.png" (update alt text to match the new image).

Remove the "fashion model displaying diverse collection" and "close-up detail of premium fabric handbag" image boxes from the About section by updating frontend/src/components/About.tsx so those two images are no longer displayed.

Remove the "Elegant woman model showcasing premium fabric ladies handbag" image box from the Hero section by updating frontend/src/components/Hero.tsx so that model image is no longer displayed; keep the Hero section responsive and visually balanced after removal (e.g., allow a text-only hero on all breakpoints or replace with a non-model existing site image already in the project).
